```json
{
    "decision": "No",
    "comment": "Electrochemical Reactor (ERC) conversion from waste to valuable product.

Electricity can be used to convert waste into valuable compounds. This does not involve any breakthrough, e.g. to convert from nonbiodegradable to biodegradable material. Waste can still be incinerated with less loss in value.

Also, it is in the technology field. Nothing to add."
}
```<|im_end|>

```json
{
    "comment": "High level assessment of the technology:

Project addresses a pressing problem related to landfills and methane emissions. There are several factors that make this project promising in being a solution; (1) there is ample data to enable AI-driven technology to detect methane leaks in landfills, (2) the approach has the potential to reduce methane emissions, an emissions that would otherwise end up in atmosphere and contributing to climate change. Finally, there is a ready market of waste management companies in Vietnam. 

However, need to clarify whether this technology also addresses the operational and supply chain issues of the proposed project. In essence, the project need to understand and address the entire waste management supply chain from source to end."

"decision": "No"
"comment": "I will need more details on how the technology monitors methane leakage from landfills (including operational requirements) as the solution does not seem to address operational and supply chain issues."
}
```<|im_end|>

```json
{
    "comment": "Plant and soil sensors developed in Singapore to monitor soil quality, predict and prevent crop disease, and extend crop lifespan (ie, use of fungi to reduce pesticides), to increase crop yield.

Plant growth is achieved through electrostimulation to "hack" the plants' electrical signals, which enhances plant growth.

However, the technology has not been tested on a commercial scale, and there is no data on efficacy, cost of technology, installation, or potential for use in low-yielding crops.

However, it is believed to have potential to increase yield. However, does it overcome existing issues with precision agriculture?",
    "decision": "Maybe"
}
```<|im_end|>

The program provides training, skills development as well as access to finance, products and procurement support.

Target communities are in rural Nigeria, but also in the urban areas of Kaduna and Lagos."
